required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Denervation Using the Vessix Renal Denervation System for the Treatment of Hypertension (REDUCE HTN:REINFORCE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Boston Scientific Clinical Trial of Renal Denervation Using the Vessix Reduce™ Catheter and Vessix™ Generator for the Treatment of HyperTensioN: REINFORCE

brief_summary.textblock: The REDUCE HTN: REINFORCE study is being conducted to determine whether the Vessix Reduce™ Catheter and Vessix™ Generator for the treatment of uncontrolled hypertension (off-treatment office systolic blood pressure ≥150 mmHg and ≤180 mmHg) shows acceptable performance at 8 weeks when compared to a masked procedure (renal angiogram).

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, multicenter, single blinded, randomized, controlled, pilot study. Subjects will be randomized to renal denervation treatment or masked renal angiogram procedure (2:1).

primary_outcome.measure: OBSERVATIONAL: Change (Mean Reduction) in Average 24-hour Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure (ASBP) Through 8 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Change (mean reduction) in average 24-hour Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure (ASBP) through 8 weeks post randomization in subjects treated with renal denervation (Test) and subjects treated with masked procedure (Control)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalizations Due to Severe Hypotension/Syncope
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hospitalizations due to severe hypotension/syncope through 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant Embolic Event Resulting in End-organ Damage or Intervention to Prevent it
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects experiencing a significant embolic event resulting in end-organ damage or intervention to prevent end-organ damage through 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal Artery Dissection or Perforation Requiring Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Number of renal artery dissection or perforation requiring intervention through 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vascular Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Number of vascular complications through 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Significant New Renal Artery Stenosis
secondary_outcome.description: Number of significant new renal artery stenosis events through 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Utilizing Anti-hypertensive Medications
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects utilizing anti-hypertensive medications at 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Reduction in Average 24-hour Ambulatory Systolic Blood Pressure at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change (mean reduction) in the average 24-hour ambulatory systolic blood pressure at 6 months compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Reduction in Average 24-hour Ambulatory Diastolic Blood Pressure Through 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change (mean reduction) in average 24-hour ambulatory diastolic blood pressure at 6 months compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Utilizing Anti-hypertensive Medications
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects utilizing anti-hypertensive medications at 6 months

secondary_outcome.description: Mean Reduction in Average 24-Hour Ambulatory systolic blood pressure at 12 months

arm_group.description: Percutaneous renal denervation using the Vessix Reduce™ Catheter and Vessix™ Generator (Vessix Renal Denervation System).

intervention.description: Percutaneous renal denervation using the Vessix Reduce™ Catheter and Vessix™ Generator
intervention.other_name: Vessix Reduce™ Catheter and Vessix™ Generator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 and ≤75 years
- OSBP ≥150 mmHg and ≤180 mmHg based on an average of 3 office-based blood pressure measurements
- Average 24-hour ASBP ≥135 mmHg and ≤170 mmHg
- For each kidney, a main renal artery, with or without accessory renal arteries, with diameter ≥3.0 mm and ≤7.0 mm and length ≥20.0 mm
- Agrees to have all study procedures performed, and is competent and willing to provide written, informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stenosis >30% or renal artery aneurysm in either renal artery
- Fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD)
- Known causes of secondary HTN
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus
- eGFR <40 mL/min/1.73m2
- Known ejection fraction of <30% or heart failure that required hospitalization in the previous 6 months
- Severe valvular heart disease
- ≥1 episode(s) of orthostatic hypotension not related to medication changes (reduction of SBP of ≥20 mmHg or DBP of ≥10 mmHg within three minutes of standing) coupled with symptoms within the past year or during screening

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
